data: Constructs a lexical resource based on WordNet, assigning sentiment scores (objective, positive, negative) to the meaning (synset) of individual words.

Contains nearly 5,000 text snippets collected from financial news and press releases about Finnish companies listed on the NASDAQ OMX Nordic Exchange. Each snippet is labeled as positive, negative, or neutral.

A dataset for understanding sentiment in financial texts, which combines artificial intelligence and semantic web technology to help better recognize, interpret, and process opinions within financial texts.

Integrates entity-sentiment annotations to solve the problem of headlines containing multiple entities with potentially conflicting sentiments. This dataset, consisting of over 10,700 news headlines annotated by humans, provides insights into sentiment changes following specific entities in financial news.

A dataset containing tokenized and annotated transcripts of Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) speeches, minutes, and press conferences. This resource aims to understand the impact of monetary policy on financial markets by analyzing the language used by the central bank.

A dataset annotated for relationships within financial documents, extracted from SEC 10-X reports, containing approximately 29,000 instances and 22 relationship types across 8 entity pairs (e.g., Person-Title, Organization-Amount). It is useful for identifying relationships between entities within financial reports.

A dataset collected from various news sources and evaluated by human experts, allowing researchers to explore the impact of news headlines on price fluctuations, asset comparisons, and other financial events.
A dataset designed for Named Entity Recognition (NER) in the financial domain, helping to identify and classify financial companies within text data.

Provides a multilingual financial NLP dataset containing real financial article headlines in 15 languages. It is annotated with high-level and low-level topics, facilitating multi-class and multi-label classification tasks.

A collection of question-answer pairs involving deep analysis of financial reports. It was authored by financial experts and provides training data for answering complex financial questions, focusing on deep reasoning over financial data.
